useCases.name: Analytics Modernization
useCases.description: Transform legacy BI systems into modern, cloud-based analytics platforms that deliver insights faster and scale with business needs.
keyBenefits: Reduce time-to-insight from weeks to minutes
Eliminate data silos and enable unified analytics
Lower total cost of ownership vs. legacy systems
typicalChallenges: Long wait times for reports and dashboards
Limited scalability of on-premise BI tools
High maintenance costs of legacy systems
Inability to handle modern data volumes
idealFor: Organizations with legacy BI tools (Cognos, BusinessObjects, etc.)
Companies migrating to cloud data warehouses
Enterprises looking to reduce BI infrastructure costs
demoScenarios: Show live query performance vs. legacy BI

useCases.name: Embedded Analytics
useCases.description: Integrate powerful analytics directly into products, applications, and workflows to deliver insights where users work.
keyBenefits: Increase product value with built-in analytics
Generate new revenue streams through analytics features
typicalChallenges: Building analytics from scratch is expensive and slow
Maintaining analytics infrastructure diverts engineering resources
Scaling analytics for multi-tenant applications
Providing customization without complexity
idealFor: SaaS companies wanting to add analytics to their product
demoScenarios: Show embedded analytics within a sample application

useCases.name: Data Democratization
useCases.description: Enable everyone in the organization to access and analyze data without depending on IT or data teams.
keyBenefits: Empower business users to answer their own questions
Reduce backlog for BI and data teams
typicalChallenges: Business users depend on IT for every report
BI team overwhelmed with ad-hoc requests
Lack of data literacy among business users
Governance concerns with self-service access
idealFor: Organizations with large BI request backlogs
Companies wanting to build data-driven culture
demoScenarios: Show business user creating analysis without SQL

useCases.name: Self-Service BI
useCases.description: Give business users intuitive tools to explore data, create visualizations, and build dashboards without technical skills.
typicalChallenges: Traditional BI tools too complex for business users
Long wait times for custom reports and dashboards
Limited exploration capabilities in current tools
High licensing costs for BI tool seats
idealFor: Organizations with diverse analytics user base
Companies looking to reduce BI team workload
Teams wanting to explore data interactively

useCases.name: Operational Analytics
useCases.description: Embed real-time analytics into operational workflows and processes to drive immediate action and decision-making.
keyBenefits: Reduce time from insight to action
typicalChallenges: Analytics separated from operational workflows
Batch processing delays critical insights
Difficulty connecting BI to operational systems
Static reports don't support dynamic operations

useCases.name: Customer 360 Analytics
useCases.description: Unify customer data from multiple sources to create comprehensive customer views and drive personalized experiences.
keyBenefits: Complete view of customer across all touchpoints
typicalChallenges: Customer data scattered across systems
Inconsistent customer definitions and metrics
Inability to analyze customer journey holistically
Delayed customer insights impact engagement
demoScenarios: Show unified customer profile with multi-source data

useCases.name: Supply Chain Analytics
useCases.description: Gain visibility across the supply chain to optimize inventory, logistics, and supplier relationships.
keyBenefits: Optimize inventory levels and reduce waste
Reduce supply chain costs and risks
typicalChallenges: Limited visibility across supply chain
Disconnected supplier and logistics data
Reactive rather than predictive planning
Difficulty identifying bottlenecks and risks
idealFor: Retail organizations with complex supply chains

useCases.name: Financial Analytics & Planning
useCases.description: Enable CFOs and finance teams to analyze financial performance, create forecasts, and drive strategic planning.
keyBenefits: Accelerate financial close and reporting cycles
Improve forecast accuracy and scenario planning
Reduce time spent on manual data preparation
typicalChallenges: Manual, spreadsheet-based financial processes
Disconnected financial and operational data
Long financial close cycles
Limited ability to perform what-if analysis
demoScenarios: Highlight drill-down from P&L to transactions
